name: Abdul Halim
notes: Independence activist and politician, fourth Prime Minister of Indonesia

name: Abdul Haris Nasution
notes: General in the Army, twice appointed Army Chief of Staff

name: Abdul Kadir
notes: Nobleman from Melawi, promoted economic development, fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Abdul Malik Karim Amrullah
notes: Islamic scholar and author

name: Abdul Muis
notes: Politician, later author

name: Abdul Rahman Saleh
notes: Early figure in the Air Force, killed when his medical flight was shot down by the Dutch

name: Abdul Wahab Hasbullah
notes: Founding father of Nahdlatul Ulama, established pro-independence organizations

name: Abdullah Bau Massepe
notes: Bugis nobleman, led attacks against Dutch forces during the National Revolution, son of Andi Mappanyukki

name: Abdurrahman Baswedan
notes: Journalist who unite Arab-descent people with Indonesians during the war for independence, later served as a diplomat.

name: Achmad Subarjo
notes: Independence activist and government minister

name: Adam Malik
notes: Journalist and independence activist, third Vice-President of Indonesia

name: Adnan Kapau Gani
notes: Independence activist turned government minister, smuggled weapons to support the National Revolution

name: Nyi Ageng Serang
notes: Javanese guerrilla leader who led attacks on Dutch colonials on several occasions

name: Agus Salim
notes: Minang Islamic leader, politician, independence activist

name: Agustinus Adisucipto
notes: Early figure in the Air Force, killed when his medical flight was shot down by the Dutch

name: Ahmad Dahlan
notes: Javanese Islamic leader, established Muhammadiyah; husband of Siti Walidah

name: Ahmad Rifa'i
notes: Islamic thinker and writer known for his anti-Dutch stance

name: Ahmad Yani
notes: Leader of the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Alimin
notes: Independence advocate, politician, and Communist Party of Indonesia figure

name: Amir Hamzah
notes: Poet and nationalist

name: Antasari
notes: Fought against Dutch colonial forces in the Banjarmasin War

name: Arie Frederik Lasut
notes: Geologist and educator who was executed by the Dutch

name: As'ad Syamsul Arifin
notes: Islamic Leader, co-founder of Nahdlatul Ulama

name: Bagindo Azizchan
notes: Mayor of Padang, resisted Dutch forces during the National Revolution

name: Basuki Rahmat
notes: General, witness to the Supersemar

name: Bernard Wilhelm Lapian
notes: Nationalist, church leader, and second governor of Sulawesi

name: Teungku Chik di Tiro
notes: Acehnese Islamic figure and guerrilla leader who fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Cilik Riwut
notes: Soldier and politician, promoted economic and cultural development in Central Kalimantan

name: Cipto Mangunkusumo
notes: Javanese politician, mentor to Sukarno

name: Cokroaminoto
notes: Politician, leader of Sarekat Islam, mentor to Sukarno

name: Ernest Douwes Dekker
notes: Indo journalist and politician who advocated Indonesian independence

name: Depati Amir
notes: Independence fighter from Bangka

name: Andi Depu Maraddia Balanipa
notes: Female figure from West Sulawesi who led fighters for independence

name: Dewi Sartika
notes: Educator, established the country's first school for girls

name: Cut Nyak Dhien
notes: Acehnese guerrilla leader who fought against Dutch colonial forces; wife of Teuku Umar

name: Diponegoro
notes: Son of the Sultan of Yogyakarta, fought a five-year war against Dutch colonial forces

name: Donald Isaac Panjaitan
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Eddy Martadinata
notes: Admiral in the Navy and diplomat, killed in a helicopter crash

name: Fakhruddin
notes: Islamic leader, negotiated protection of Indonesian hajj pilgrims

name: Fatmawati
notes: Sewed the first national flag, social activist, a wife of Sukarno

name: Ferdinand Lumbantobing
notes: Doctor and politician, fought for the rights of forced labourers

name: Frans Kaisiepo
notes: Papuan nationalist who helped in the acquisition of Papua

name: Gatot Mangkupraja
notes: Independence activist and politician, suggested the formation of Defenders of the Homeland

name: Gatot Subroto
notes: General, deputy chief-of-staff of the Army

name: Halim Perdanakusuma
notes: Early figure in the Air Force, killed during the National Revolution

name: Hamengkubuwono I
notes: Sultan of Yogyakarta, fought against the Dutch East India Company, established Yogyakarta

name: Hamengkubuwono IX
notes: Sultan of Yogyakarta, independence activist, military leader, and politician; second Vice-President of Indonesia

name: Harun Bin Said
notes: Bombed the Hong Kong and Shanghai Bank building in Singapore during the Indonesia–Malaysia confrontation

name: Hasan Basri
notes: Soldier during the Indonesian National Revolution, supported the integration of Kalimantan in Indonesia

name: Hasanuddin
notes: Sultan of Gowa, fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Hasyim Asy'ari
notes: Islamic leader, founder of Nahdlatul Ulama

name: Hazairin
notes: Legal scholar, independence activist, government minister, and educator

name: Herman Johannes
notes: Engineer, made weapons during the National Revolution, helped establish Gadjah Mada University

name: Ida Anak Agung Gde Agung
notes: Independence activist and government minister

name: Idham Chalid
notes: Leader of Nahdlatul Ulama, politician

name: Ilyas Yakoub
notes: Independence activist, politician, and guerrilla fighter

name: Tuanku Imam Bonjol
notes: Islamic figure from West Sumatra who fought against Dutch colonial forces in the Padri War

name: Radin Inten II
notes: Nobleman from Lampung, led a revolution against Dutch colonists

name: Iskandar Muda
notes: Sultan of Aceh, expanded the state's influence

name: Ismail Marzuki
notes: Composer known for numerous patriotic songs

name: Iswahyudi
notes: Early figure in the Air Force, killed during the National Revolution

name: Iwa Kusumasumantri
notes: Independence activist, lawyer, and politician

name: Izaak Huru Doko
notes: Independence activist and educator, helped establish Udayana University

name: Djamin Ginting
notes: Politician and military officer in Sumatra during the National Revolution

name: Janatin
notes: Bombed the Hong Kong and Shanghai Bank building in Singapore during the Indonesia–Malaysia confrontation

name: Jatikusumo
notes: General in the Army and politician

name: Andi Jemma
notes: Independence activist, led attacks against Dutch forces during the National Revolution

name: Johannes Abraham Dimara
notes: Papuan army officer who helped in the acquisition of Papua

name: Johannes Leimena
notes: Early Minister of Health, developed the Puskesmas clinic system

name: Juanda Kartawijaya
notes: Sundanese politician, final Prime Minister of Indonesia

name: Karel Satsuit Tubun
notes: Police brigadier, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Kartini
notes: Javanese women's rights figure

name: Ignatius Joseph Kasimo
notes: Independence activist, Catholic Party leader

name: Kasman Singodimedjo
notes: Muhammadiyah figure, who united the nation during the UUD 1945 Constitution ratification process by the Preparatory Committee for Indonesian Independence. Later served as chair of the Central Indonesian National Committee, the precursor of the People's Representative Council and as Justice Undersecretary.

name: Katamso Darmokusumo
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: I Gusti Ketut Jelantik
notes: Balinese leader who fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: I Gusti Ketut Puja
notes: First governor of Bali

name: Ki Hajar Dewantara
notes: Educator and government minister, established Taman Siswa, brother of Suryopranoto

name: Ki Sarmidi Mangunsarkoro
notes: Educator with Budi Utomo and Taman Siswa, government minister

name: Kiras Bangun
notes: Batak guerrilla leader who fought the Dutch colonialists

name: Kusumah Atmaja
notes: First Chief Justice of the Supreme Court

name: La Maddukelleng
notes: Nobleman from Paser Sultanate, repelled Dutch forces from Wajo Kingdom

name: Lafran Pane
notes: Founded the Muslim Students' Association

name: Lambertus Nicodemus Palar
notes: Diplomat, negotiated recognition of Indonesia during the Revolution

name: John Lie
notes: Rear Admiral in the Navy, smuggled products to fund the National Revolution

name: Mahmud Badaruddin II
notes: Sultan of Palembang, fought against English and Dutch colonists

name: Sultan Mahmud Riayat Syah
notes: Sultan of Riau Lingga, fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Malahayati
notes: Fighter and nobless, against Cornelis de Houtman force

name: Mangkunegara I
notes: Fought against Dutch colonists and collaborators in Central Java

name: Andi Mappanyukki
notes: Bugis nobleman, led attacks against Dutch forces in the 1920s and 30s, father of Andi Abdullah Bau Massepe

name: Maria Walanda Maramis
notes: Women's rights advocate and educator

name: Martha Christina Tiahahu
notes: Guerrilla fighter from Maluku who died in Dutch custody

name: Marthen Indey
notes: Nationalist and independence activist, promoted Papuan integration in Indonesia

name: Mas Mansur
notes: Islamic scholar, Muhammadiyah leader

name: Mas Tirtodarmo Haryono
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Maskun Sumadireja
notes: Independence activist and politician

name: Cut Nyak Meutia
notes: Acehnese guerrilla leader who fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Mohammad Hatta
notes: Independence activist, First Vice-President of Indonesia

name: Mohammad Husni Thamrin
notes: Politician and independence activist

name: Mohammad Natsir
notes: Islamic scholar and politician, fifth Prime Minister of Indonesia

name: Muhammad Noor
notes: Banjar Prince, guerrilla fighter, former Minister of Public Works.

name: Teuku Muhammad Hasan
notes: Independence activist, first governor of Sumatra

name: Muhammad Yamin
notes: Poet turned politician and independence activist

name: Muhammad Zainuddin Abdul Madjid [id]
notes: Islamic scholar and Nahdlatul Wathan founder

name: Mustopo
notes: Leader during the Battle of Surabaya, established Dr. Moestopo Dental College

name: Muwardi
notes: Handled security for the Proclamation of Independence, established a hospital in Surakarta

name: Nani Wartabone
notes: Independence activist and politician, helped put down the Permesta rebellion

name: I Gusti Ngurah Made Agung
notes: Balinese fighter against the Dutch

name: I Gusti Ngurah Rai
notes: Balinese military leader during National Revolution

name: Nuku Muhammad Amiruddin
notes: Sultan of Tidore, led several naval battles against Dutch colonial forces

name: Nur Ali
notes: Islamic leader and educator, led student soldiers during the National Revolution

name: Teuku Nyak Arif
notes: Acehnese politician and resistance leader, first governor of Aceh

name: Opu Daeng Risaju
notes: Early woman politician, fought against the Dutch during the National Revolution

name: Oto Iskandar di Nata
notes: Politician and independence activist

name: Pajonga Daeng Ngalie
notes: Coordinated attacks in South Sulawesi during the National Revolution, promoted national integration

name: Pakubuwono VI
notes: Susuhunan of Surakarta, rebelled against Dutch colonial forces

name: Pakubuwono X
notes: Susuhunan of Surakarta, supported various projects which furthered Native Indonesian interests

name: Pattimura
notes: Guerrilla from Maluku who fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Pierre Tendean
notes: Soldier in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Pong Tiku
notes: Torajan noble, fought against Dutch colonialists

name: Raja Ali Haji
notes: Historian and poet from Riau

name: Raja Haji Fisabilillah
notes: Warrior from Riau who fought against Dutch colonial forces

name: Rajiman Wediodiningrat
notes: First head of the People's Representative Council

name: Ranggong Daeng Romo
notes: Led troops in two battles against Dutch forces during the National Revolution

name: Rasuna Said
notes: Women's rights advocate and nationalist

name: Robert Wolter Mongisidi
notes: Guerrilla fighter in Makassar during the National Revolution, executed by the Dutch

name: Saharjo
notes: Minister of Justice, pioneered legal reform in the country

name: Sam Ratulangi
notes: Minahasa politician and supporter of Indonesian independence

name: Samanhudi
notes: Businessman, established Sarekat Islam

name: Silas Papare
notes: Fought for Papua's independence from the Netherlands, promoted Papuan integration in Indonesia

name: Sisingamangaraja XII
notes: Batak leader who fought a lengthy guerrilla campaign against Dutch colonial forces

name: Siswondo Parman
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Siti Hartinah
notes: Wife of then-president Suharto, active in social work, established Taman Mini Indonesia Indah

name: Syam'un
notes: Islamic scholar, guerrilla fighter for independence.

name: Siti Walidah
notes: Founder of Aisyiyah, Muhammadiyah figure, wife of Ahmad Dahlan,

name: Slamet Riyadi
notes: Brigadier General in the Army, killed while putting down a rebellion in Sulawesi

name: Sudirman
notes: Commander in Chief of the Indonesian Armed Forces for most of the National Revolution

name: Albertus Sugiyapranata
notes: Javanese Catholic bishop and nationalist

name: Sugiyono Mangunwiyoto
notes: Colonel in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Suharso
notes: Medical pioneer in prosthetics

name: Sukarjo Wiryopranoto
notes: Independence figure, diplomat, and politician

name: Sukarni
notes: Youth leader and activist

name: Sukarno
notes: Independence activist who read the Proclamation of Independence, first President of Indonesia

name: Sultan Agung
notes: Sultan of Mataram, fought against encroachment by the Dutch East India Company

name: Sultan Daeng Radja
notes: Independence activist and politician

name: Supeno
notes: Government minister, killed while fighting against the Dutch during the National Revolution

name: Supomo
notes: First Minister of Justice, helped write the Constitution

name: Suprapto
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Supriyadi
notes: Leader of a rebellion against the Japanese occupation forces in Blitar

name: Suroso
notes: Politician and independence activist

name: Suryo
notes: Governor of East Java during the National Revolution

name: Suryopranoto
notes: Education and workers' rights figure, brother of Ki Hajar Dewantara

name: Sutan Syahrir
notes: Politician, first Prime Minister of Indonesia

name: Sutomo
notes: Javanese educator, established Budi Utomo

name: Sutomo
notes: Military officer who led troops in the Battle of Surabaya

name: Sutoyo Siswomiharjo
notes: General in the Army, killed by the 30 September Movement

name: Syafruddin Prawiranegara
notes: First governor of Bank Indonesia

name: Syarif Kasim II
notes: Sultan of Siak, promoted integration of the East Sumatran kingdoms

name: Tahi Bonar Simatupang
notes: General who served as chief of staff from 1950 to 1954

name: Tuanku Tambusai
notes: Islamic leader from Riau who fought against Dutch colonial forces in the Padri War

name: Tan Malaka
notes: Minang politician and communist activist

name: Thaha Syaifuddin
notes: Sultan of Jambi, led an armed revolution against Dutch colonial forces

name: Tirtayasa
notes: Guerrilla from Banten who fought against the Dutch

name: Tirto Adhi Suryo
notes: Early journalist, exiled for his anti-Dutch editorials

name: Teuku Umar
notes: Acehnese guerrilla leader who fought against Dutch colonial forces; husband of Cut Nyak Dhien

name: Untung Surapati
notes: Led several rebellions against the Dutch East India Company

name: Urip Sumoharjo
notes: Early leader of Indonesian Armed Forces, second in command to Sudirman

name: Wage Rudolf Supratman
notes: Composer of the national anthem '/Indonesia Raya/'

name: Wahid Hasyim
notes: Leader of Nahdlatul Ulama, first Minister of Religion of Indonesia

name: Wahidin Sudirohusodo
notes: Doctor and leader in Budi Utomo

name: Wilhelmus Zakaria Johannes
notes: Medical pioneer in radiology

name: Yos Sudarso
notes: Commodore of the Navy, killed in a confrontation with the Dutch over Netherlands New Guinea

name: Yusuf Tajul Khalwati
notes: Islamic leader, led a guerrilla rebellion against the Dutch East India Company

name: Zainal Mustafa
notes: Islamic leader who fought against the Japanese occupation forces

name: Zainul Arifin
notes: Politician and guerrilla fighter, killed by an assassin targeting Sukarno
